intro: Amsinckia solida, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features hairy, lobed leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent stamens. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Amsinckia solida is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
